title: Thunderbird not saving edits to address book
content: I went through all the trouble of adding everyone's address and phone in my Address Book and saved each one and went back later and none of the addresses or phone numbers were there. Simply didn't save. Not going to re-enter until I can figure it out!
creator: JanSw

title: Change double spacing of the email display
content:
When I open Thunderbird all the emails are listed BUT they are double spaced. This is not the spacing of an email response, just the way they are displayed when TB is opened. I'm sure it is a simple mouse click selection but it eludes me. Can anyone suggest the choice? There are two computers and one of them displays exactly they way wanted. The other one show each email double spaced before opening it. The attached image is the display I want. Thanks for any help.

Larry Kamberg ldkamb@frontier.com
creator: ldkamb

title: Modifying display (font size, color, background) of incoming mail
content: I want to modify the display of the body of emails I receive in Thunderbird. Version 115.6.0 64-bit on Windows. At some point, not sure when, the body of mail from some correspondents appears in tiny yellow characters on a black background; if it's a response to my email, my text is in small gray letters on black, almost invisible. Changing themes has not helped; the heading can be made light but the body is unaltered. Didn't find anything in Settings that worked either.
creator: ronks1

title: importing emails
content: I just bought a new PC. I have Thunderbird on the old PC, and now installed it on the new PC. When I opened it on the new PC, it only downloaded 475 emails. On the old PC, I had over 15,000 emails. How can I get the new PC to downloaded the rest of the emails?
creator: hashmark28

title: my WAPO delivery being stopped by someone
content: All of a sudden 4-5 days ago I no longer can receive my Washington Post, only way is to scroll way down to last known one. What in blazes is going on at Tbird? Who is responsible? Is there anyone who can put it back at once? Yes my subscription is valid. If all of you refuse my small request, it means I have to PAY my own tech support, which is not fair of you. I don't care who messed it up; I only want my paper back NOW. I have noticed that Tbird is now run by volonteers; is that the problem? PLEASE help. Thank you
creator: margykr

title: Calendar View Events limited to max 1 year, no more option to view All events, in versions 118 and above
content: In every version from 118 beta to the latest, the Calendar View Events filter option is limited to max 1 year. In previous versions, there was a filter option to view All events. I need this option in filter to be re-instated because 1 year is not enough. I want to see all events to manage my calendar more effectively.
creator: hmp

title: Autostart on versions 114 and above (except the latest beta version) shows nothing after splash.
content: Autostart on versions 114 and above (except the latest beta version) shows nothing after splash. It launches the first time, but then on every PC windows 11 restart, the splash screen loads, and then nothing happens. I have to manually launch it, and then TB asks me to close it because it's already launched. I click to close and then TB launches successfully. I've tried using the minimized/maximized and Admin options in properties, as well as Batch scripts. But it doesn't work.
creator: hmp

title: Thunderbird errore accesso al file system
content: La versione di thunderbird e' aggiornata all'ultima versione disponibile, ma l'errore di accesso al file system si e' verificato anche con le versioni precedenti. Thunderbirdo in modo casuale e occasionale quando si scaricano nuovi messaggi o si inviano nuovi messaggi segnala l'errore come da immagine allegata. Il sistema operativo in uso e' windows 10 22h2, ho provato ad escludere da microsoft security essential sia il processo di thunderbird che la cartella di thunderbird relativa al profilo ma non e' servito a risolvere il problema, spazio libero su disco fisso oltre 350 GB. Per poter continuare ad utilizzare Thunderbird quando si verifica l'errore devo chiudere e riaprirlo.

title: .thunderbirds permissions messed up
content:
I must admit that I was very upset when I discovered some time ago that permissions for my files and folders in .thunderbird were messed up in a way that had given all files permission to run as programs. Now I have been living with it for a while without disaster, and I found out the reason for it is that I used ntfs format instead of ext4 on my backup disk. However it still feels bad, and I still don't know how to fix it correctly.

I have for many years before used Fat32 for my backup, .thunderbird included. And it looks like Fat32 takes all those permissions away, so if I just do that again and restore, the illness in quest will be cured. There are some symbolic files I can't copy to Fat32 but Thunderbird doesn't seem to care. Could that be a good way to fix it.?

Or can I perhaps expect an automatic update eventually will fix it.?

Or how do I fix it correctly.?

Thank you in advance.
creator: Jakob77

title: Lost my Local Folders after Windows reload
content: This is probably a mess of my own making, having been lazy about back ups. My laptop threw a critical error at me just before Christmas and I could only fix it by doing a reset and reload of Windows 10. (I think it may have been a partial HDD corruption) I selected the option to retain personal data files etc, but the reload wiped almost all my installed programs, including Thunderbird. Documents, etc folders have all survived. I re-installed the latest Thunderbird and it is working fine. However, I appear to have lost my Local Folders (as well as my address book) Not a life-or-death matter, but I would prefer to recover them, if possible. I have an "..@tiscali.co.uk" (TalkTalk) email account, with IMAP settings on the incoming mail and SMTPS on "sent" items. I can see all incoming emails that are still on the server, but the "sent" items folder is empty. All local folders and contents are gone. I have read up on the Thunderbird Profile and understand that it is separate from the program folder. I have used the "Help>Troubleshooting>..." feature to find that my current profile is "zqx......default-release". Using file search, it also indicates that there is another profile file, "k32....j5.default", in the same area. Both have creation dates corresponding to the reload time. I cannot find anything similar in the "Windows.old" folder that was created at the time of the reload. Is it possible that the folder contents are still in the HDD and it is just the file address that is lost? Thanks. Neil
creator: neil.mander

title: Thunderbird 122b1 breaks Comcast SMTP
content:
I have upgrade Thunderbird beta to 122b1 and it now breaks my ability to send email via Comcast SMTP. nothing has changed in the configuration. I get a pop-up saying "Login to server smtp.comcast.net with username ************@comcast.net failed." There are two failures here: First is the ability to send email through Comcast SMTP and second when I get the error dialog and press the "Enter New Password" button the dialog goes away, but I never see the dialog to change the password.

I had been trying to troubleshoot this on my main desktop with no success. I have two other email accounts using different SMTP servers and both of those send email properly.

This morning I pulled out a laptop which had 121b1 installed on it. When I started Thunderbird I confirmed the version and then sent out two emails. Both of which were sent correctly. I shutdown Thunderbird and restarted it again. This time it had upgraded to 122b1. I tried to send an email through the Comcast SMTP server and that failed. I sent an email through the Gmail SMTP server and that worked fine.

Looking for guidance on how to fix this problem since I hate using a web-based client. Thanks.

title: Sharing Calendar across devices and other people
content:
Hello everyone,

First of all I would like to say that I love Thunderbird! I am also not very IT literate when it comes to manipulating software or using the correct language so please bear with me, I find these a bit overwhelming.

I was hoping someone could help me with with my calendar, I have tried to change settings on other software and it went terribly wrong and I don't want a repeat. I have read the various help files but it doesn't make much sense to me :(

I have a domain with Dynadot for my website and email, it's basic but does the job for my small business. It has IMAP abilities and an autoreply but that's about it- there's no calendar app but does have an email app... just. On my Windows laptop I use Thunderbird for all emails and calendar requirements which is great when I'm using my laptop. However, I do meet with participants and don't always use my laptop so I need a way to be able to view and book appointments using my andriod phone.

I also have a member of staff who needs access to my calendar and be able to book appointments for me and vice versa. As we are both out and about a lot the calendars need to be "live" and easy to reach, much like the paid for Outlook shared calendar.

At the moment my member of staff doesn't use Thunderbird as their main software, they have Outlook. We did try another email/calendar app but their shared calendars were just links that we had to save and keep logging into, it was a nightmare and without the updating we had some double-bookings. I don't want to go through that again, it was embarassing.

I would greatly appreiciate your wisdom in how I can resolve my issue and easy step by step guidance on how to do it properly. I am the type of person who will get locked out of everything!

Best wishes Rebecca
creator: admin781

title: Thunderbird is extremely slow after the new UI update 115.4.2
content:
THIS IS A SERIOUS ISSUE - IF IT ISN'T FIXED PRETTY QUICK I'M PORTING OUT - AFTER USING TB FOR 8 YEARS...

The all-new-all-singing-and-dancing Supernova grinds to a halt. There is a thread here: https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/discussions/thunderbird-is-extremely-slow-after-the-new-ui-update-115-4-2/m-p/48006#M17136 that is addressing the complaints of some users but I see nothing by way of developers engaging this issue (or even being aware).

To set the context I posted this (below) at the end of last year. Do any of the new TB development team actually look at these comments? You have a BIG problem here ladies and gentlemen. You just made your shiny new product fall flat on its face.

~~~ ‚Äé12-27-2023 02:56 PM

So time to cut to the chase. (the following are descriptions of context, showing the latency) 1. Left-click on a folder in the left pane; right-click to show secondary floater menu; select "mark folder read": 5 seconds 2. Left click on left pane/folder expand/contract arrow: 5 - 10 secs (varies) 3. Left click on left pane (waiting for right-hand pane to show folder contents: 5 seconds 4. (when viewing right-hand pane: folder contents: 600 messages in the folder) using slidebar to track up and down the folder, so going from "right at the bottom" to "right at the top": 5 seconds 5. Left-click on a folder in the left pane; right-click to show secondary floater menu; select "create new folder": 8 seconds 6. Click on search bar, enter text (type-ahead): 8 seconds for text to appear and search to start 7. Right-click on trash in the left pane (to select "empty trash" (17 messages)): 10 seconds to display 8. On closing always get the pop-up saying "unresponsive window, do you want to close" - but then always eventually gets there and closes.

"5 seconds" appears to be a regular occurrence. Issue with servicing the key-press and mouse click queue?

In other respects this wonderful new interface is an unmitigated disaster and whoever decided that it was ok to release TB115 in this state should be SHOT !!!

~~~ (and to add insult to injury:) 9. click "help" tab / "about": 9 seconds to display the pop-up ...

~~~ So whats your plan, then?

~~~ Misterjat ‚Äé12-30-2023 02:15 AM Not sure they have one. Do they even bother to read these comments?
creator: nick.theboatman

title: Clicking certain embeded web links causes email to disappear in message pane
content:
After a recent upgrade by our Spam server system, the embedded links from that System no longer open in a web browser when clicked in the email. We can open the link by "right-clicking" and choosing "open in browser". If done this way - all is well. But if we simply click on the link, the message pane area clears and all subsequent messages clicked in the message header window are also cleared in the message pane (doesn't matter what email it is or if it has an embedded link). Thunderbird appears to be trying to open the web page within the message pane, not opening a browser window to display web page. This is happening on at least 3 copies of Thunderbird running latest releases.

A reload of Thunderbird resolves the problem until link is clicked again.

Not a huge problem as we can work around it. Other links work fine.

Running 115.6.0 (64)
creator: jepoe
